Name: Requiring reports on removals involving individuals experiencing homelessness and the outcomes for those individuals.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring reports on removals involving individuals experiencing homelessness and the outcomes for those individuals

Summary: This bill would require the Commissioner of Social Services to produce two quarterly reports, in consultation with the Police Commissioner, the Commissioner of Sanitation, and the Commissioner of Parks and Recreation. The first report would track each time a city agency worked to remove a person experiencing homelessness from a public space, including when the removal was coordinated among multiple agencies and when a person was asked to vacate a public space by a police officer. The second report would track how many individuals were affected by the removal, what housing services they were offered and whether there were any involuntary removals or arrests.

\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\noline\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx6705\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\fs24 Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 21 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 21-152 to read as follows:\fs27\par
\ul\fs24\'a7 21-152 Reports on removals involving individuals experiencing homelessness. a. Definitions. For purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings:\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Affected individual. The term \ldblquote affected individual\rdblquote  means any individual perceived as experiencing homelessness who is temporarily or permanently removed from a location or whose personal property has been cleared at a location.\par
Agency removal. The term \ldblquote agency removal\rdblquote  means a removal by or on behalf of any agency or agencies or a removal where an agency representative was present, except that such term does not include a police-directed removal.\par
Police-directed removal. The term \ldblquote police-directed removal\rdblquote  means a removal by an employee of the police department without coordination with another agency or entity.\par
Removal. The term \ldblquote removal\rdblquote  means an action or directive by or on behalf of any agency, that results in an individual perceived as experiencing homelessness temporarily or permanently leaving a location or the clearing by or on behalf of any agency of personal property, which may include a sleeping bag, shelter, tarp, tent, bed, cardboard, metal sheeting, furniture, or other objects at a location. \par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf0 Robot. The term \ldblquote robot\rdblquote  means an artificial object or system that senses, processes, and acts, to at least some degree, and is operated either autonomously by computers or by an individual remotely. The term does not include unmanned aerial vehicles.\par
\cf1 Shelter. The term \ldblquote shelter\rdblquote  means a building or individual units within a building, used by the department or by a person under contract or similar agreement with the department to provide temporary emergency housing.\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf0 Transitional housing. The term \ldblquote transitional housing\rdblquote  means placement in a shelter, stabilization bed, or safe haven. \par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf1 b. \cf0 No later than 1 month after the effective date of the local law that added this section, and quarterly thereafter,\cf1  the commissioner, in consultation with the police commissioner, the commissioner of sanitation, and the commissioner of parks and recreation, shall submit to the speaker of the council, the public advocate, and the mayor, and publish on the department\rquote s website, in a machine readable format, a report on removals conducted during the prior month. The report shall include a table in which each row references a unique occurrence of a removal. Each such row shall include the following information and any additional information the commissioner deems appropriate, set forth in separate columns:\par
1. A unique identification number for each removal;\par
2. Whether the removal was an agency removal or a police-directed removal;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\li720\sl480\slmult1\qj 3. The council district where the removal occurred;\par
4. Whether or not at removal has previously been conducted at that location;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 5. The source of initiation for the removal, including but not limited to requests by an agency, office, organization, or 311 report;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\li720\sl480\slmult1\qj 6. The date and time of the start of the removal;\par
7. The agencies and divisions within agencies with personnel present for the removal;\par
8. The non-government entities present for the removal;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 9. The number of agency personnel present and total hours spent on the removal by personnel, disaggregated by agency; \par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\li720\sl480\slmult1\qj 10. The number of affected individuals involved in the removal; and\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 11. The cost of removals, including, but not limited to, the costs associated with the following information: \par
(a) The number of agency staff present during and before a removal, disaggregated by the agency and relevant job title; \par
(b) The total time an agency was present before and during a removal; \par
(c) Any overtime hours used to conduct a removal, including a methodology on how overtime hours were calculated; and \par
(d) Any additional costs such as the use of any specialized equipment during a removal, including unmanned aerial vehicles and robots. \par
c. \cf0 No later than 1 month after the effective date of the local law that added this section, and quarterly thereafter,\cf1  the commissioner shall submit to the speaker of the council, the public advocate, and the mayor and publish on the department\rquote s website, in a machine readable format, a report on the same-day outcomes for individuals experiencing homelessness involved in a removal during the prior month. Such report shall include a table in which each row references a unique occurrence of a removal. Each such row shall include the following information, as well as any additional information the commissioner deems appropriate, set forth in separate columns:\par
1. A reference to the unique removal identification number as reported in subdivision b of this section;\par
2. The council district where the removal occurred;\par
3. The number of affected individuals on the date of the removal;\par
4. The number of affected individuals who were offered housing vouchers on the date of the removal; \par
5. The number of affected individuals who were offered housing voucher applications on the date of the removal;\par
6. The number of affected individuals who were offered direct permanent housing placements on the date of the removal; \par
7. The number of affected individuals who were offered supportive housing on the date of the removal;\par
8.  The number of affected individuals who were offered placement in transitional housing on the date of the removal;  \par
9. Any services not listed in paragraphs 4 to 8 of this subdivision\b  \b0 offered to an affected individual on the date of the removal;\par
10. The number of affected individuals who were detained involuntarily and brought to a hospital for a mental health evaluation  pursuant to section 9.41 or 9.58 of the mental hygiene law;\par
11. The number of affected individuals who entered transitional housing on the date of the removal; and\par
12. The number of affected individuals who were arrested on the date of the removal.\par
\cf0 d. The reports required by subdivisions b and c of this section shall include a data dictionary.\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj e. Except as otherwise expressly provided in this section, no report required by subdivision b or c of this section shall contain personally identifiable information.\par
f. No information that is otherwise required to be reported pursuant to this section shall be reported in a manner that would violate any applicable provision of federal, state, or local law relating to the privacy of information. \par
\cf1\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect \cf0 100 days\cf1\fs20  \fs24 after it becomes law. \par
